Dear @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> ,

 

Please be advised that today at 4pm, our Regional Retail Manager, @Waheeb AlYounes <mailto:Waheeb.Alyounes@faces.com> , our Stock Controller, @Mohammed Chelakkoden <mailto:Mohammed.Chelakkoden@faces.com> , and I oversaw the destruction of all the items.

 

Attached are pictures for your reference. Please inform us when we can expect to receive the invoice from the insurance company.

 

Best Regards,

Mazen

Yes. Please destroy the items and provide photos as evidence in order to get full compensation.

 

If you want to keep the items without destroying, we can reduce the indemnity by 20%-25% for any individual product you would like to keep and use let’s say as a tester.

 

Otherwise, in order to receive full settlement, we need to destroy the items as they are branded and we need to make sure there is no residual value so that the insurance pays the replacement cost in full.

 

Remain at your disposal for any assistance required.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Please share the below requirements.

 

 

1.            Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.            Report from Mall Management.

3.            CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.            CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.            Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.            Trade License copy.

7.            Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.            Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.            No of Staff working in the store.

10.         How many staff under Faces working in store and how many staff under third-party suppliers working in store

 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

Based on loss adjuster’s inspection, he requires to compile and provide the following documents for review:

 

1.             Detailed occurrence report [description of loss indicating the cause of loss].

2.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

3.             Report from Mall Management.

4.             Photographs and videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

5.             Photographs and videos on the incident date for the damaged property.

6.             Your detailed total claim bill with supported documents i.e. invoices/bills/quotations etc.

7.             Trade License copy.

8.             Complete Tenancy Contract.

9.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

10.          Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

11.          Number of Staff inside the store.

12.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

 

Please keep the affected/damaged items in a safer place until obtaining confirmation from the insurer.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well.

 

Kindly note that there was a water leakage due to AC.

 

Total stock damages is around USD 5,000.

 

Details of the incident are as follows:

 

Location:           FACES MOE

DOL:                   15/08/2023

Incident:            Water Leakage from the ceiling due to an issue with the AC system. Damaged products duly mentioned in the attached document.

 

The damaged stock have been separated for inspection if required. Please co-ordinate with @Mazen Ichtay <mailto:Mazen.Ichtay@chalhoub.com>  for any survey requirement.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Please be advised that today at 4pm, our Regional Retail Manager, @Waheeb AlYounes <mailto:Waheeb.Alyounes@faces.com> , our Stock Controller, @Mohammed Chelakkoden <mailto:Mohammed.Chelakkoden@faces.com> , and I oversaw the destruction of all the items.

Best Regards,

Yes. Please destroy the items and provide photos as evidence in order to get full compensation.

 

If you want to keep the items without destroying, we can reduce the indemnity by 20%-25% for any individual product you would like to keep and use let’s say as a tester.

 

Otherwise, in order to receive full settlement, we need to destroy the items as they are branded and we need to make sure there is no residual value so that the insurance pays the replacement cost in full.

 

Remain at your disposal for any assistance required.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear Hani,

 

Thank you for your below e-mail.

 

Kindly note that the invoice from CGR is the basis of Valuation for FACES.

 

Trust that there is no foul play. However, CGR is a different cost center with their own P&L and they are the distributor for Faces as well as third party companies.

 

Kindly request the loss adjuster to consider the provided invoices for the basis of the loss valuation in order to close this claim.

 

Thank you as always for your kind support.

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Please share the below requirements.

 

 

1.            Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.            Report from Mall Management.

3.            CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.            CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.            Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.            Trade License copy.

7.            Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.            Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.            No of Staff working in the store.

10.         How many staff under Faces working in store and how many staff under third-party suppliers working in store

 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

Dear Hagop,

 

We understood from the loss adjuster that the below are still pending:

 

1.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.             Report from Mall Management.

3.             CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.             CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.             Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.             Trade License copy.

7.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.             Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.             No of Staff inside the store.

10.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

Hani Gebara

Based on loss adjuster’s inspection, he requires to compile and provide the following documents for review:

 

1.             Detailed occurrence report [description of loss indicating the cause of loss].

2.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

3.             Report from Mall Management.

4.             Photographs and videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

5.             Photographs and videos on the incident date for the damaged property.

6.             Your detailed total claim bill with supported documents i.e. invoices/bills/quotations etc.

7.             Trade License copy.

8.             Complete Tenancy Contract.

9.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

10.          Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

11.          Number of Staff inside the store.

12.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

 

Please keep the affected/damaged items in a safer place until obtaining confirmation from the insurer.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

Location:           FACES MOE

Hagop

Dear @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> ,

 

Please be advised that today at 4pm, our Regional Retail Manager, @Waheeb AlYounes <mailto:Waheeb.Alyounes@faces.com> , our Stock Controller, @Mohammed Chelakkoden <mailto:Mohammed.Chelakkoden@faces.com> , and I oversaw the destruction of all the items.

 

Attached are pictures for your reference. Please inform us when we can expect to receive the invoice from the insurance company.

 

Best Regards,

Mazen

Yes. Please destroy the items and provide photos as evidence in order to get full compensation.

 

If you want to keep the items without destroying, we can reduce the indemnity by 20%-25% for any individual product you would like to keep and use let’s say as a tester.

 

Otherwise, in order to receive full settlement, we need to destroy the items as they are branded and we need to make sure there is no residual value so that the insurance pays the replacement cost in full.

 

Remain at your disposal for any assistance required.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Thank you for your below e-mail.

 

Kindly note that the invoice from CGR is the basis of Valuation for FACES.

 

Trust that there is no foul play. However, CGR is a different cost center with their own P&L and they are the distributor for Faces as well as third party companies.

 

Kindly request the loss adjuster to consider the provided invoices for the basis of the loss valuation in order to close this claim.

 

Thank you as always for your kind support.

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Please share the below requirements.

 

 

1.            Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.            Report from Mall Management.

3.            CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.            CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.            Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.            Trade License copy.

7.            Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.            Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.            No of Staff working in the store.

10.         How many staff under Faces working in store and how many staff under third-party suppliers working in store

 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

Dear Hagop,

 

We understood from the loss adjuster that the below are still pending:

 

1.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.             Report from Mall Management.

3.             CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.             CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.             Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.             Trade License copy.

7.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.             Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.             No of Staff inside the store.

10.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

Dear Hagop,

 

Thank you for your email.

 

We look forward to receiving the pending details as per loss adjuster’s requirements:

 

1.             Detailed occurrence report [description of loss indicating the cause of loss].

2.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

3.             Report from Mall Management.

4.             Trade License copy.

5.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

6.             Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

7.             Number of Staff inside the store.

8.             How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

Based on loss adjuster’s inspection, he requires to compile and provide the following documents for review:

 

1.             Detailed occurrence report [description of loss indicating the cause of loss].

2.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

3.             Report from Mall Management.

4.             Photographs and videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

5.             Photographs and videos on the incident date for the damaged property.

6.             Your detailed total claim bill with supported documents i.e. invoices/bills/quotations etc.

7.             Trade License copy.

8.             Complete Tenancy Contract.

9.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

10.          Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

11.          Number of Staff inside the store.

12.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

 

Please keep the affected/damaged items in a safer place until obtaining confirmation from the insurer.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well.

 

Kindly note that there was a water leakage due to AC.

 

Total stock damages is around USD 5,000.

 

Details of the incident are as follows:

 

Location:           FACES MOE

DOL:                   15/08/2023

Incident:            Water Leakage from the ceiling due to an issue with the AC system. Damaged products duly mentioned in the attached document.

 

The damaged stock have been separated for inspection if required. Please co-ordinate with @Mazen Ichtay <mailto:Mazen.Ichtay@chalhoub.com>  for any survey requirement.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​

INSURANCE SPECIALIST

DUBAI

Dear Hani,

 

We provided the invoices of the top 10 items only for validation as a sample.

 

We always provide validation for a sample and not the entire list of damages when the number of items damaged are high.

 

Appreciate if you can request the surveyor to consider the provided details as sufficient evidence so that we can close the claim.

 

Thank you for your support as always.


Best Regards,

Hagop

Hagop

Yes. Please destroy the items and provide photos as evidence in order to get full compensation.

 

If you want to keep the items without destroying, we can reduce the indemnity by 20%-25% for any individual product you would like to keep and use let’s say as a tester.

 

Otherwise, in order to receive full settlement, we need to destroy the items as they are branded and we need to make sure there is no residual value so that the insurance pays the replacement cost in full.

 

Remain at your disposal for any assistance required.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Thank you for your below e-mail.

 

Kindly note that the invoice from CGR is the basis of Valuation for FACES.

 

Trust that there is no foul play. However, CGR is a different cost center with their own P&L and they are the distributor for Faces as well as third party companies.

 

Kindly request the loss adjuster to consider the provided invoices for the basis of the loss valuation in order to close this claim.

 

Thank you as always for your kind support.

Dear Hagop,

 

Greetings.

 

Please share the below requirements.

 

 

1.            Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

2.            Report from Mall Management.

3.            CCTV videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

4.            CCTV footage showing the incident for the damaged property.

5.            Purchase invoice/Commercial invoice from the manufacturer/distributor/supplier.

6.            Trade License copy.

7.            Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

8.            Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

9.            No of Staff working in the store.

10.         How many staff under Faces working in store and how many staff under third-party suppliers working in store

 

 

Thanking you.

 

Best Regards,

Based on loss adjuster’s inspection, he requires to compile and provide the following documents for review:

 

1.             Detailed occurrence report [description of loss indicating the cause of loss].

2.             Eyewitness Statement of the incident.

3.             Report from Mall Management.

4.             Photographs and videos of the pre-incident for the loss location.

5.             Photographs and videos on the incident date for the damaged property.

6.             Your detailed total claim bill with supported documents i.e. invoices/bills/quotations etc.

7.             Trade License copy.

8.             Complete Tenancy Contract.

9.             Total value of stocks at the time of loss.

10.          Inventory list for the last 6 months for this location.

11.          Number of Staff inside the store.

12.          How many staff under Faces and how many staff under third-party suppliers?

 

Please keep the affected/damaged items in a safer place until obtaining confirmation from the insurer.

 

Regards,

 

Hani Gebara
Claims Manager – General Insurance

!

EXTERNAL EMAIL
Do not click on links or attachments unless you recognize the sender and know that the content is safe.

 

Dear Hani,

 

Hope you are well.

 

Kindly note that there was a water leakage due to AC.

 

Total stock damages is around USD 5,000.

 

Details of the incident are as follows:

 

Location:           FACES MOE

DOL:                   15/08/2023

Incident:            Water Leakage from the ceiling due to an issue with the AC system. Damaged products duly mentioned in the attached document.

 

The damaged stock have been separated for inspection if required. Please co-ordinate with @Mazen Ichtay <mailto:Mazen.Ichtay@chalhoub.com>  for any survey requirement.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

Dear @Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> ,

 

Please be advised that today at 4pm, our Regional Retail Manager, @Waheeb AlYounes <mailto:Waheeb.Alyounes@faces.com> , our Stock Controller, @Mohammed Chelakkoden <mailto:Mohammed.Chelakkoden@faces.com> , and I oversaw the destruction of all the items.

 

Attached are pictures for your reference. Please inform us when we can expect to receive the invoice from the insurance company.

 

Best Regards,
